stateEmergencyManagement.overview: States face critical inflection point as FEMA reliability decreases

federalContext.femaReviewCouncil: Established Jan 2025 to 'reenvsion federal role in disaster management'
federalContext.femaAct2025: HR bipartisan reform bill in Congress
federalContext.coreStaffCuts: 50+ CORE workers terminated NYE 2025; CORE = 40% of FEMA workforce
federalContext.budgetHeldUp: $17B in FEMA aid to states currently delayed/denied

rainyDayFunds.usage: Some states (Oregon) using rainy day funds for disaster purposes
rainyDayFunds.trend: All but 4 states have rainy day funds

stateBudgetRealities.disasterTracking: Most states lack standardized disaster cost tracking
stateBudgetRealities.floridaModel: Division of Emergency Management reimburses agencies from central fund

stateOpportunities.budget: Added $30M to contingency fund (response to FEMA uncertainty)

stateEmergencyManagement.targetMetric: 319.5M in EMPG funds flow to states annually - technology is allowable expense

femaContracts.overview: FEMA contracts through SAM.gov remain significant despite uncertainty

advanceContracts.description: Pre-positioned goods/services for rapid disaster response
advanceContracts.opportunity: Coordination layer for advance contract activation

femaContracts.smallBusinessAdvantage: SBA programs provide set-asides for disaster-related contracts

vcLandscape2025.overview: VC selective but AI and impact sectors seeing investment

disasterSpecificFunding.politicoInsight: Sequoia and 4+ billion-dollar funds investing in climate failure adaptation
disasterSpecificFunding.thesis: Betting that disasters will increase, adaptation tech needed

sosImplications: Impact/climate investors interested in disaster resilience
State budgets provide customer revenue path

sosAddressableMarket.samRationale: Start with 5-10 state EMAs, expand from there

keyInsights.insight: States are self-funding due to FEMA uncertainty
keyInsights.evidence: New Mexico added $30M contingency, Texas has $20B rainy day fund
keyInsights.sosAction: Target states proactively building disaster capacity

keyInsights.evidence: No major competitor focuses on community-agency coordination
keyInsights.sosAction: Position as bridge between agencies and community resources

keyInsights.insight: Foundation funding aligns with SOS mission
keyInsights.evidence: Hilton, Google.org, Rockefeller all explicitly fund disaster coordination innovation
keyInsights.sosAction: Prioritize foundation grants for early capital

keyInsights.evidence: Bezos, Schmidt, Google all investing heavily in AI for climate/disaster
keyInsights.sosAction: Ensure AI/ML features are core to product positioning

keyInsights.evidence: Reddit feedback: 'expensive and slow compared to Veoci'
keyInsights.sosAction: Market to frustrated WebEOC users seeking modern alternative
